page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW, HARROW.
page.content: Our D-block reflects the essential nature of a suburban London commuter belt. Much of the area is a mixture of housing and open spaces. Public amenities reflect the needs of the local population. There are plenty of restaurants, supermarkets and transport outlets to London. Leisure needs are catered for by parks, sports grounds and a Leisure Centre. There is also a popular Arts Centre as well as several libraries. Industry is not a prominent feature of this block, although Kodak and warehousing generate local employment. Religious needs are catered for by most denominations. Education services provide for the needs of all age groups. Our D-block also contains the administrative nerve-centre of Harrow, along with a well-stocked reference library.
